item.title: Slain Muslim teen's memorial set ablaze, suspect 'does not appear to be motivated by bias' - RT
item.description:
Slain Muslim teen's memorial set ablaze, suspect 'does not appear to be motivated by bias'  RT

A memorial for a murdered Muslim teen was set on fire at Washington’s Dupont Circle and a man was detained shortly afterward. Nabra Hassanen, 17, was killed with a baseball bat Sunday in what police controversially described as a “road rage” incident. John Solomon, 24, of South Carolina, was arrested just after 10:00am Wednesday, US Park Police spokeswoman Sergeant Anna Rose said. “At this time, the incident does not appear to be motivated by bias,” she said, according to the New York Daily News. Solomon was reportedly setting several objects on fire at the park. DC Fire said they responded...

item.title: Nabra Hassanen: Virginia police treating Muslim teenager's killing as 'road rage' incident, not hate crime - The Independent
item.description:
Nabra Hassanen: Virginia police treating Muslim teenager's killing as 'road rage' incident, not hate crime  The Independent

A teenage Muslim girl killed by a bat-wielding motorist near a Virginia mosque was an apparent victim of "road rage" and her death is not being investigated as a hate crime, police said on Monday. Nabra Hassanen, 17, was attacked early on Sunday in Sterling, Virginia, about 30 miles (50 km) west of Washington, after attending late-night prayers for the Muslim holy month of Ramadan, when many Muslims fast from dawn until sunset. Darwin Martinez Torres, 22, of Sterling, has been arrested and charged with murder in the incident that began with a road dispute with a boy on a bicycle who was amo...

item.title: Don't tell me Nabra Hassanen, the Muslim girl who was kidnapped outside a mosque and murdered, was a victim of road rage - The Independent
item.description:
Don't tell me Nabra Hassanen, the Muslim girl who was kidnapped outside a mosque and murdered, was a victim of road rage  The Independent

On Father’s Day, Mohmoud Hassanen spent the day at the mosque. It’s not unusual for Muslims to spend extra time at the mosque during Ramadan, our holy month, which is in its last – and most sacred – days. Hassanen spent Sunday in the mosque not for Ramadan prayers, but to pray for the safe return of his daughter, sixteen year old Nabra Hassanen, who went missing in the early morning hours after leaving the mosque to enjoy a pre-dawn meal with a group of friends. Nabra never made it home safely. Her body was found in a pond later that afternoon. She had been brutally beaten with a baseball b...

item.title: Pennsylvania Man Charged With Murdering Teen In 'Savage' Road Rage Incident - HuffPost
item.description:
Pennsylvania Man Charged With Murdering Teen In 'Savage' Road Rage Incident  HuffPost

A Pennsylvania man has been charged with the murder of a recent high school graduate during a road rage dispute last week. David Desper, 28, turned himself in to authorities early Sunday, Chester County District Attorney Tom Hogan said at a press conference that morning. He was charged with first- and third-degree murder, possession of an instrument of crime and reckless endangering in the slaying of 18-year-old Bianca Roberson in West Goshen Township last Wednesday. Arrest in West Goshen road rage murder. #chescojusticehttps://t.co/RIwilr3myj?ncid=NEWSSTAND0001 — Tom Hogan (@DATomHogan) Ju...

item.title: 3-Year-Old Killed in Road Rage Shooting - The Daily Beast
item.description:
3-Year-Old Killed in Road Rage Shooting  The Daily Beast

A Little Rock, Arkansas three-year-old was shot and killed Saturday evening, after an irate driver opened fire on the child’s grandmother, police say. The young boy’s grandmother, Kim King-Macon, 47, had taken him out for holiday shopping, when she slowed for a stop sign in southwest Little Rock. But a nearby driver decided the woman was moving too slowly at the stop sign. In what police describe as a road rage incident, the driver pulled a gun and fired on the car, striking and killing the three-year-old. The shooting was senseless and unprovoked, police said in a press conference. The boy...

item.title: Biker charged with killing pensioner over suspected road rage incident - The Telegraph
item.description:
Biker charged with killing pensioner over suspected road rage incident  The Telegraph

A motorcyclist has been charged with killing a pensioner in front of his wife in a suspected road rage incident. Stuart Bowdler, 74, was taking his wife Margaret, 61, to the pub when the couple were involved in a collision with a motorcyclist as they turned into a car park in their Ford Focus. The retired plumber left his car to speak to the biker when an alleged altercation took place.​ The couple, who had been married for 37 years, were taking a trip to their local pub the Boot and Shoe Inn in Chesterfield, Derbyshire, when the incident happened. Colin Bailey, 30, from Clay Cross, Derbys...

item.title: 'Get ready to die': Sir David Attenborough's TV producer in shocking road-rage incident - The Telegraph
item.description:
'Get ready to die': Sir David Attenborough's TV producer in shocking road-rage incident  The Telegraph

A TV producer behind many of David Attenborough's acclaimed wildlife documentaries told a family "I want you to die" as he tried to place them under citizen's arrest in a road rage incident. Fergus Beeley was caught on camera delivering the astonishing tirade on Saturday after they pulled over following a minor crash on the M27 near Portsmouth, Hampshire. Simon Gale, 33, who was in the other car with his wife Louise, their son, and his mother-in-law, said Mr Beeley flew into a "raving state" after both cars were forced to pull over at the side of the motorway. Mr Beeley's rage is caught on ...

item.title: Highway road rage leads to fiery wreck after motorcyclist kicks car (VIDEO) - RT
item.description:
Highway road rage leads to fiery wreck after motorcyclist kicks car (VIDEO)  RT

A road rage incident is believed to have sparked a terrifying multiple crash crash on a freeway in Santa Clarita, north of Los Angeles involving a motorcycle, a car and an SUV. The shocking camera footage shows two people involved in road rage encounter which ends in an incendiary mess on the California State Route 14, southbound. It all started when a motorcyclist kicked the side of a sedan. The sedan retaliated and swerved into the man on the motorbike and accidentally hit the divider. The sedan then hit a Chevy pick-up truck and flipped it onto its roof, according to KNBC. The motorcycli...

item.title: Fatal road rage punch thrown after tailgating, cursing, Brisbane court hears - ABC News
item.description:
Fatal road rage punch thrown after tailgating, cursing, Brisbane court hears  ABC News

A man accused of punching another driver who fell into the path of an oncoming garbage truck says he lashed out after being tailgated and cursed at on a busy Brisbane motorway. Tamate Henry Heke has pleaded not guilty to the manslaughter of Shane Merrigan, who was hit by the truck at a busy merge on the Gateway Motorway at Rochedale in December 2015. A police interview with Heke recorded on the night of Mr Merrigan's death was played to the jury in which he told officers he was driving home from a 12-hour shift. Photo: Cameras caught the traffic disruptions after the the incident at Rocheda...

item.title: Road rage killer Kenneth Noye wins open prison challenge - The Telegraph
item.description:
Road rage killer Kenneth Noye wins open prison challenge  The Telegraph

Road-rage killer Kenneth Noye has won a legal challenge that could see him moved to an open prison. The 69-year-old, was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum tariff of 16-years in 2000 after being found guilty of stabbing 21-year-old electrician Stephen Cameron to death in an attack on the M25 in Kent in 1996. In September 2015 the Parole Board declined to order his release, but recommended he be transferred to open conditions. But the board's recommendation was rejected by then justice secretary Michael Gove. Stephen Cameron was murdered by Noye in 1996Credit: PA A judge has now over...

item.title: Man punches woman in NSW road rage assault - ABC News
item.description:
Man punches woman in NSW road rage assault  ABC News

Police are investigating a suspected road rage assault after viewing dash cam footage showing a man punching a woman in the face at Lake Munmorah in New South Wales. Vision has been viewed by Tuggerah Lakes police which shows a man getting out of his car, walking towards a woman as she stood next to her vehicle and punching her in the face. Chief Inspector Col Lott said the level of violence depicted in the footage was totally unacceptable. "Obviously with any video footage we're only getting a snapshot of the whole incident," he said. "It depicts a male walking up to a female and punching ...

item.title: Cyclist airlifted to hospital with serious injuries after road rage incident - The Telegraph
item.description:
Cyclist airlifted to hospital with serious injuries after road rage incident  The Telegraph

A cyclist was airlifted to hospital with serious head injuries on Sunday after a road rage incident involving motorbiker in an historic town centre. Detectives are investigating the incident which happened on Sunday morning and scenes of crime officers sealed off an area of pavement outside a pub on a busy dual carriageway road in Rochester, Kent close to the 103-year-old Rochester Bridge. Rochester Railway Bridge across the River Medway Credit: Olaf Protze Police say the victim, who has not yet been identified, was involved in an altercation with a motorcyclist. One witness, who did not w...

item.title: Toddler killed in Arkansas road rage incident; manhunt underway - CNN
item.description:
Toddler killed in Arkansas road rage incident; manhunt underway  CNN

Police are searching for the gunman who shot and killed a toddler during an apparent road rage incident in Little Rock, Arkansas. Investigators are offering a $40,000 reward for information leading to an arrest and conviction of the person who shot 3-year-old Acen King. The toddler was on a shopping trip with his grandmother over the weekend when the gunman opened fire, police said. The incident began Saturday evening when a motorist behind the grandmother grew agitated that she was not moving quickly enough at a stop sign, Little Rock Police Department spokesman Lt. Steven McClanahan said....

item.title: Man sentenced in road rage shooting involving George Zimmerman - CNN
item.description:
Man sentenced in road rage shooting involving George Zimmerman  CNN

The man convicted of shooting at George Zimmerman in a road rage incident has been sentenced to 20 years in prison, Florida authorities said Monday. Matthew Apperson was convicted of attempted second-degree murder in September. In addition to the 20-year sentence, he was also given a 15-year concurrent sentence for aggravated assault stemming from the same incident, Seminole County State Attorney spokeswoman Lynne Bumpus-Hooper said. The road rage incident happened in Lake Mary, Florida, in May 2015. Zimmerman testified that Apperson followed him, flashing his lights and honking his horn. A...

item.title: Arkansas man arrested in fatal road rage shooting of three-year-old boy - The Guardian
item.description:
Arkansas man arrested in fatal road rage shooting of three-year-old boy  The Guardian

A Little Rock man accused of fatally shooting a three-year-old boy in what police called a road rage incident has surrendered to federal and local authorities, the US Marshals Service said Friday. Gary Eugene Holmes, 33, was taken into custody without incident on Thursday, in connection with the shooting death last week of Acen King, according to Joshua Kaplan, a senior inspector for the US Marshals Service in Little Rock. Holmes was being held in the Pulaski County jail without bond on preliminary charges of capital murder and committing a terroristic act. Police said Acen was on a shoppin...

item.title: Suspect Arrested In Road Rage Death Of 3-Year-Old Boy - The Huffington Post
item.description:
Suspect Arrested In Road Rage Death Of 3-Year-Old Boy  The Huffington Post

A suspect has been charged in the Arkansas road rage death of a 3-year-old boy last weekend. Acen King was riding in the backseat of his grandmother’s car Saturday night during a Christmas shopping trip when a man shot into the vehicle because it “wasn’t moving fast enough,” Little Rock police Lt. Steve McClanahan said after the shooting. Acen was struck in the back and died later of his injuries at Arkansas Children’s Hospital. This is 3-yr-old Acen King, the victim of last night's road rage. The shooter fired after King's grandma took too long at a stop sign. pic.twitter.com/rPSQD5MLpx — ...

item.title: Arkansas police hunt motorist who 'killed three-year-old in road rage incident' - The Independent
item.description:
Arkansas police hunt motorist who 'killed three-year-old in road rage incident'  The Independent

Police in Arkansas are hunting for a man who opened fire in an an apparent road rage incident - killing a three-year-old boy who had been taken shopping by his grandmother. Reports said that the boy’s grandmother was driving through the city of Little Rock on Saturday night when another motorist opened fire. Police said that at some point, the person started firing at her car because he thought she “wasn’t moving fast enough at a stop sign”. The boy was struck at least once and was taken to a hospital where he died shortly afterwards. The grandmother was unhurt. None of the identities of th...

item.title: Arkansas child killing: 911 tapes capture grandmother's agony - CNN
item.description:
Arkansas child killing: 911 tapes capture grandmother's agony  CNN

The weekend shopping trip wasn't supposed to end like this. One minute, the grandmother of 3-year-old Acen King steered them toward the JC Penney in Little Rock, Arkansas. The next, the boy was fatally shot in the seat of her maroon Dodge Charger. "My [grandson's] been shot," she wailed over the phone to a 911 dispatcher. "Oh my God!" The shrill screams of the grandmother echoed through the sprawling mall parking lot Saturday night. The 911 calls released Monday capture the heartbreak of a woman who lost her grandson to gun violence after an apparent road rage incident. Police continued to ...

item.title: Miss Black Texas Says Police Chief Illegally Arrested Her In Fit Of Racist Road Rage - HuffPost
item.description:
Miss Black Texas Says Police Chief Illegally Arrested Her In Fit Of Racist Road Rage  HuffPost

Miss Black Texas 2016 is calling for a North Texas police chief to be removed from his job after he allegedly called her a “black bitch” and unlawfully arrested her for passing his 14-year-old daughter on the road. Carmen Ponder, an intern at the Hunt County district attorney’s office and a recent graduate of Texas A&M University, tweeted Tuesday that she experienced “road rage” from Kerry Crews, the police chief in Commerce, Texas. Police brutality and Abuse of Power from a Police Chief. Let me talk to my lawyer and I'll fill y'all in #blacklivesmatter — Carmen Sensei (@CarmenSierraaa) May...

item.title: Woman punched in road rage incident charged - ABC News
item.description:
Woman punched in road rage incident charged  ABC News

Police have charged a 21-year-old woman over a road rage incident on the NSW Central Coast. The charges come after footage was shared widely on social media showing a man leave his car and approach a woman before punching her in the face. Police say two cars were travelling along the Pacific Highway in Lake Munmorah on Monday when they stopped at an intersection. An argument then broke out between the woman and man. Today, the woman attended Wyong Police Station where police laid a raft of charges including malicious damage, being armed with intent to commit an indictable offence, intention...

item.title: Suspect in road rage killing turns himself in - CNN
item.description:
Suspect in road rage killing turns himself in  CNN

A man accused of shooting and killing an 18-year-old woman in a case of road rage is being held without bail on murder charges after turning himself in Sunday morning, authorities said. ©2017 Cable News Network, Inc. A Time Warner Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Police Call Teen's Beating Death 'Road Rage.' That Doesn't Sit Well With Muslim Americans. - HuffPost
item.description:
Police Call Teen's Beating Death 'Road Rage.' That Doesn't Sit Well With Muslim Americans.  HuffPost

Early Sunday morning in Sterling, Virginia, 17-year-old Nabra Hassanen was attacked and beaten to death with a baseball bat en route to the local mosque with friends. Hassanen and the other teens had just eaten at an IHOP for suhoor, the pre-dawn meal during the holy month of Ramadan. It was just about 4 a.m., and the group was heading back to the All Dulles Area Muslim Society Center when an altercation with a motorist quickly escalated. The teens fled. Hassanen was wearing an abaya ― a traditional long dress commonly worn by Muslim women ― and she reportedly tripped on it and fell behind ...

item.title: Actor who played The Omen's Damien sentenced on Friday 13th for road rage - The Guardian
item.description:
Actor who played The Omen's Damien sentenced on Friday 13th for road rage  The Guardian

The actor who played Damien Thorn in the 1970s horror film The Omen punched two cyclists in a road-rage attack and has been given a suspended prison sentence – on Friday the 13th. Harvey Spencer Stephens, 46, lashed out at two riders and damaged one of their cycling helmets after getting out of his car after a dispute, a court heard. He pleaded guilty to two counts of ABH (actual bodily harm) and one of causing criminal damage following the attack on Toys Hill, Westerham, Kent, on 21 August last year. Maidstone crown court heard that father-of-two Stephens was “red-faced and angry” when he ...

item.title: Man pleads not guilty over 'viral' road rage incident - ABC News
item.description:
Man pleads not guilty over 'viral' road rage incident  ABC News

The man at the centre of a violent road rage incident on the NSW Central Coast that went viral online has pleaded not guilty to an assault charge. Clint Matthew Pollard, 41, briefly appeared in Wyong Local Court on Wednesday, charged with assault occasioning actual bodily harm. Pollard, from Windermere Park, was charged after footage showing a man leaving a vehicle and approaching a woman before punching her in the face was shared widely on social media. The footage, taken on a mobile phone, was given to police. Police alleged the incident occurred at the intersection of the Pacific Highway...

item.title: Road rage suspect turns himself in, faces murder charges - CNN
item.description:
Road rage suspect turns himself in, faces murder charges  CNN

A man accused of shooting and killing an 18-year-old woman in a case of road rage is being held without bail on murder charges after turning himself in Sunday morning, authorities said. David Desper, 28, faces multiple charges, including first-degree murder and reckless endangerment, Chester County District Attorney Tom Hogan said. Suspect David Desper West Goshen Police Department Police said he shot Bianca Nikol Roberson after he became angry as their vehicles were merging on the same lane of a highway Wednesday evening in West Goshen, Pennsylvania, just west of Philadelphia. item.title: Man charged over road rage incident - ABC News
item.description:
Man charged over road rage incident  ABC News

A man has been charged over a road rage incident on the New South Wales Central Coast, police have said. The 41-year-old man is accused of punching a 21-year-old woman in the face during an argument on the Pacific Highway at Lake Munmorah on Monday afternoon. Police received mobile phone footage of the attack. Vision posted on social media shows a man getting out of his car, walking towards a woman as she stood next to her vehicle and punching her in the face. This morning, a Windermere Park man presented himself to police at Wyong. He was charged with assault occasioning actual bodily harm...

item.title: Driver who screamed abuse at Jeremy Vine is convicted - The Guardian
item.description:
Driver who screamed abuse at Jeremy Vine is convicted  The Guardian

A 22-year-old woman has been found guilty over a road rage incident filmed by BBC presenter Jeremy Vine. Shanique Syrena Pearson, 22, was found guilty at Hammersmith magistrates court of using threatening or abusive behaviour and driving without reasonable consideration over a confrontation with Vine that took place on 26 August last year. Her lawyer, James O’Keeffe, said Vine’s involvement in the case had ensured the case was far more high profile than it should have been and said Pearson had faced racial abuse as a result. The Crimewatch and Radio 2 presenter posted video online of a “sca...

item.title: 'Biggest mistake of his life' led to fatal road rage, court hears - ABC News
item.description:
'Biggest mistake of his life' led to fatal road rage, court hears  ABC News

A New Zealand man on trial over a fatal road rage incident made "probably the biggest mistake of his life" when he pulled over, a Brisbane court has been told. Tamate Henry Heke, 38, has been accused of punching 50-year-old Shane Merrigan and causing him to fall into the path of a garbage truck on the Gateway Motorway at Eight Mile Plains on Brisbane's southside in December 2015. Heke has pleaded not guilty to manslaughter and the alternative charge of unlawful striking causing death. In summing up the case, defence counsel Anthony Kimmins told the Supreme Court "there was aggressive drivin...

item.title: Australians are among the luckiest people on Earth. What are we so angry about? - The Guardian
item.description:
Australians are among the luckiest people on Earth. What are we so angry about?  The Guardian

I’m driving to Denpasar airport in Bali (or rather being driven, I am still learning to drive) and it’s a nightmare. I see three near-collisions. Yet no one is honking their horn. There are hundreds of cars and motorbikes jammed into a terrible road yet the streets are actually kind of quiet. “Where’s all the road rage?” I ask my driver. “What’s road rage?” he asks. Ha ha ha, what’s road rage. Related: On my night at the astrology hotel I'm the sexy Scorpio, stumped for an answer | Brigid Delaney I give him the sanitised version. “It’s this thing we have in Australia, where if you cut someo...

item.title: British IT worker 'facing six months in prison' in Dubai for giving fellow driver the finger - The Independent
item.description:
British IT worker 'facing six months in prison' in Dubai for giving fellow driver the finger  The Independent

A British IT worker says he faces a possible six-month term in a Dubai prison for sticking his middle finger up at another driver during a road row. Jamil Ahmed Mukadam, 23, made the rude gesture as he made his way to the airport in a hire car after a holiday in the Gulf state with his wife in February. When he returned to the oil-rich emirate on 10 September he was arrested at immigration control and initially held in a police cell with criminals including rapists and murderers, he told The Sun. He told the paper he was later released on bail to a hotel but had his passport confiscated to ...

item.title: Police blame warm weather for road rage assaults - ABC News
item.description:
Police blame warm weather for road rage assaults  ABC News

Police believe too much sunshine could be contributing to the violent road rage incidents caught on camera in New South Wales this week. The explanation comes as footage emerged of a peak-hour brawl erupting in Sydney's west — the second road rage attack to be filmed in as many days. In the mobile phone vision, four men can be seen getting out of their cars and throwing punches in the middle of a busy road in Merrylands. As the fight intensifies, one of the men kicks another. Meanwhile, police on the Central Coast are still investigating after a woman was punched in the face after apparentl...

item.title: Boy, 3, killed in Arkansas road rage shooting over slow driving, police say - The Guardian
item.description:
Boy, 3, killed in Arkansas road rage shooting over slow driving, police say  The Guardian

A three-year-old boy who was being taken on a shopping trip by his grandmother was killed in a road rage shooting when a driver opened fire on the grandmother’s car because she “wasn’t moving fast enough at a stop sign”, police said. The boy and his grandmother were at the stop sign in south-west Little Rock on Saturday evening when a driver, apparently angry about the delay, stepped out of his car and opened fire, police said. The boy was struck by gunfire at least once, they said. The grandmother, who wasn’t struck, drove away and called police from a shopping center. Police arrived at th...

item.title: Two men start fight with martial artist in Birmingham road rage incident - it did not end well - The Independent
item.description:
Two men start fight with martial artist in Birmingham road rage incident - it did not end well  The Independent

A road rage incident ended unexpectedly for two men when they took on another driver who appeared to be schooled in martial arts. The fight, which stopped traffic in the Northfield area of Birmingham, was caught on camera by a passer-by. Footage of the incident has recently appeared online. The video, taken on 2 September,shows two of the men lashing out at each other in the middle of the road as cars beep their horns. - Read more Furious man filmed punching and headbutting windscreen of moving car As shoppers lookn on, the men, one of whom is dressed in black and the other in a red t-shirt...

item.title: Three-year-old Acen King killed in Arkansas road rage shooting - The Telegraph
item.description:
Three-year-old Acen King killed in Arkansas road rage shooting  The Telegraph

Police in Arkansas are hunting for a gunman who shot dead a three-year-old boy in a suspected road rage. Kim King-Macon, 47, told police that she was driving her grandson Acen King and a one-year-old to do some Christmas shopping on Saturday, when she stopped at a stop sign. She said a man drove up behind her, apparently thought she was moving too slowly and honked his horn. She honked back and drove off. The man then got out of his car and opened fire. Ms King-Macon did not realise her grandson had been hit until they arrived at the shopping centre. "Tonight's homicide was a road rage inci...

item.title: Two thirds of drivers have suffered a road rage attack – and women are the main victims - The Telegraph
item.description:
Two thirds of drivers have suffered a road rage attack – and women are the main victims  The Telegraph

Britain's crowded roads can be unpleasant at times, but a recent poll suggests that the problem with aggressive drivers is more common than first thought. A startling 61 per cent of motorists say they have suffered a physical or verbal attack while driving. Three quarters said that they'd experienced a "threatening gesture" from another road user. In total, 80 per cent of drivers – four in every five – have been the victim of some form of road rage aggression. Men are apparently the worst offenders, with the majority of abusers being males with an average (estimated) age of around 37. Men a...

item.title: Jeremy Vine road rage driver's lawyer pleads for leniency as she has 'already been punished' on Twitter - The Telegraph
item.description:
Jeremy Vine road rage driver's lawyer pleads for leniency as she has 'already been punished' on Twitter  The Telegraph

A driver filmed screaming at BBC presenter Jeremy Vine as he rode his bike has been warned she could face jail, despite her lawyer claiming that she has already been "punished" on social media. Shanique Syrena Pearson shouted abuse at the BBC star, made a gun sign and threatened to knock him out during the row as he cycled on a narrow road with parked cars on both sides. The 22-year-old single mother was told on Wednesday she might face prison after being convicted at Hammersmith Magistrates' Court of road rage offences. But Pearson's defence lawyer, James O'Keeffe, said she was vilified on...

item.title: Driver who threatened Jeremy Vine jailed as police say it should serve as a 'warning' to road rage drivers - The Telegraph
item.description:
Driver who threatened Jeremy Vine jailed as police say it should serve as a 'warning' to road rage drivers  The Telegraph

A driver who threatened BBC presenter Jeremy Vine has been jailed as police say it should serve as a “warning” to road rage drivers. Shanique Syrena Pearson, 22, threatened to knock out Mr Vine in an abusive rant seen by millions after a video clip posted online by the Radio 2 DJ went viral. Detective Inspector Driss Hayoukane, of Notting Hill CID, said: "Road rage incidents like this are completely unacceptable. "Threatening anyone with violence is unacceptable and a criminal offence. "I hope this sentence serves as a warning and important reminder that all road users should be respected a...

item.title: Driver who ploughed into cyclists after spraying them with windscreen wash is jailed - The Independent
item.description:
Driver who ploughed into cyclists after spraying them with windscreen wash is jailed  The Independent

A road-rage driver has been jailed after being found guilty of deliberately swerving into a group of cyclists – including two children. South Derbyshire Magistrates Court heard how John Rafferty “saw the red mist” because he was unable to get past the group of a dozen cyclists, which included two 12-year-old boys, as they were riding two abreast down a country road at Coton in the Clay, near Tutbury in Staffordshire. The 50-year-old repeatedly honked his horn at the cycling club, the CC Giro from Sutton Coldfield in the West Midlands, swerved into the group three times in an attempt to over...

item.title: Man Risks Death To Take Selfie With The Rock In Oncoming Traffic - HuffPost
item.description:
Man Risks Death To Take Selfie With The Rock In Oncoming Traffic  HuffPost

Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson isn’t one of those celebrities you need to pretend not to notice in public, as you go live on Instagram from underneath the table of the restaurant you both happen to be dining in. No, he’s more likely to welcome you with open and unfathomably muscular arms, whether you spot him on a red carpet or, you know, stopped in traffic on a busy road. That’s what happened when the “Baywatch” actor was driving his pick-up truck when a man abandoned his own truck in the opposite lane to snag a selfie with the star. Even though Johnson warned the fan about the potential danger...

item.title: Police: Nabra Hassanen killed in 'road rage incident' - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Police: Nabra Hassanen killed in 'road rage incident'  Al Jazeera English

The murder of a teenage Muslim girl beaten and killed by a bat-wielding motorist near a Virginia mosque was likely a "road rage incident", not a hate crime, US police said, prompting outrage from many who say the teen was targeted because of her religion. Darwin Martinez Torres, 22, has been arrested and charged with Nabra Hassanen's murder in an incident police say began as a road dispute with a male teenager who was among Hassanen's group. "It appears that the suspect became so enraged over this traffic argument that it escalated into deadly violence," Fairfax County police spokeswoman Ju...
